channel.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
channel.description: Hi, I was just wondering if there's any way to avoid putting your server's real ip address into the status page because anyone can easily find my server and get its ip to DDOS it. Is there anyway to avoid the status page from showing the IP? Or how can I use a fake ip to put up there? Thanks in advance.

item.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Hai guies i use my massive botnet to pick on puny little servers. A fine tuned server can very easily handle a DoS attack.

Read full topic

[/quote]

implying anyone within the rsps community knows how to obfuscate or even utilizes that method of security[/quote]implying_anyone_in the rsps community cba to take the time to actually deob ~^ (well besides anything worthwhile…)

item.source: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS

item.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
item.dc:creator: @ultimate_ownage ultimate ownage
item.description:
@ultimate_ownage wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:9, topic:525059”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=643753.msg4332856#msg4332856 date=1373913835]
learn to use netstat idiots.
[/quote]
This.

Yeah, it takes 5 seconds to look at the status page, but it takes 10 seconds to run a simple decompiling program. What I use: http://java.decompiler.free.fr/?q=jdgui

And emphasizing on Vain’s comment, all you have to do is log into a server, open up your CMD, type “netstat -a” find what IP’s you are connected too, and if you’re connected to more than one it’s most likely the one connected to 43594 since nobody ever changes that…

Just so nobody tries telling you to get no-ip, you can easily get to the IP being this by pinging that.

The only free defense against attacks is knowing how to correctly utilize a firewall.[/quote]

Hmm interesting. Thanks for the information.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS

item.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Vain_:

learn to use netstat idiots.

This.

Yeah, it takes 5 seconds to look at the status page, but it takes 10 seconds to run a simple decompiling program. What I use: http://java.decompiler.free.fr/?q=jdgui

And emphasizing on Vain’s comment, all you have to do is log into a server, open up your CMD, type “netstat -a” find what IP’s you are connected too, and if you’re connected to more than one it’s most likely the one connected to 43594 since nobody ever changes that…

Just so nobody tries telling you to get no-ip, you can easily get to the IP being this by pinging that.

The only free defense against attacks is knowing how to correctly utilize a firewall.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS

item.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
item.dc:creator: @ultimate_ownage ultimate ownage
item.description:
@ultimate_ownage wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:7, topic:525059”]To say that DDOS protection isn’t cheap is a false statement. All you need to do is find a VPS that allows you to control the firewall. We were able to run a server on a $10 VPS and we withstood DDOS attacks on the daily. (With 200+ people online)

EDIT: There is always a way around getting someones IP address. Even if you somehow blocked someone from getting ahold of your IP through server-status pages, and the client. There are still programs that tell you what IP’s are being sent packets, and sending packets. So you are never truly safe.[/quote]

10$ VPS? Dafuq? What company and what revision is your server?

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS

item.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

To say that DDOS protection isn’t cheap is a false statement. All you need to do is find a VPS that allows you to control the firewall. We were able to run a server on a $10 VPS and we withstood DDOS attacks on the daily. (With 200+ people online)

EDIT: There is always a way around getting someones IP address. Even if you somehow blocked someone from getting ahold of your IP through server-status pages, and the client. There are still programs that tell you what IP’s are being sent packets, and sending packets. So you are never truly safe.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Toplist leaves server open to DDOS
item.dc:creator: @ultimate_ownage ultimate ownage
item.description:
@ultimate_ownage wrote:

Fridder:

If someone really wanted to attack the server, they would decompile the client and locate the server ip.

Which isn’t easy. It would take me just 5 seconds to find the ip address of the server because of the MS status page.

Read full topic
